intro: Piper cumbricola var. montevagum, commonly known as the mountain pepper vine, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and possesses compound leaves with elongated, pointed leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
